<<<<<<< HEAD
A comment upon the two tales of our ancient, renovvned, and ever-living poet Sr Jeffray Chaucer, Knight who for his rich fancy, pregnant invention and present composure deserved the countenance of a prince and his laureat honor : the Miller's tale and the Wife of Bath : addressed and published by special authority. Brathwaite, Richard, 1588?-1673.
[2], 199 p.
Printed by W. Godbid and are to be sold by Peter Dring ..., London : 1665.
Dedication signed: R.B. Reproduction of original in the Pembroke College (University of Cambridge) Library.
=======

Brathwaite, Richard, 1588?-1673.
[2], 199 p.
Printed by W. Godbid and are to be sold by Peter Dring ..., London : 1665.
Dedication signed: R.B. Reproduction of original in the Pembroke College (University of Cambridge) Library.
